itemDescription: missing Jihadist and former UK citizen (disappeared 2019)

wikipedia_page.main:
Sharmeena Begum (sometimes transliterated as Shamina; born 1999) is one of the jihadi brides. She left the United Kingdom to join the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) in December 2014. Two months later, in February 2015, school friends Amira Abase, Shamima Begum, and Kadiza Sultana joined her in occupied Syria. Begum is one of the youngest British teenagers to join ISIL.
In February 2019 Begum was described as "missing".

response: In December 2014, a female pupil at the school, Sharmeena Begum, left the UK to join the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL). In February 2015, three more female pupils known as the Bethnal Green trio - Shamima Begum, Amira Abase, and Kadiza Sultana - left via Turkey to join ISIL. Five further female pupils at the school were subject to a travel ban and were made wards of court to prevent them leaving the country. Counter-extremism officers from the Department for Education investigated the school.
* Sharmeena Begum (born 1999), left the United Kingdom to join the ISIL in December 2014
* Sharmeena Begum – (British fighter, Missing since June 2018)

The disappearance resulted in the Metropolitan Police giving evidence to the Home Affairs Select Committee of the House of Commons on its circumstances in March 2015. The families of the girls received an apology from Scotland Yard, who did not tell them about Sharmeena Begum (unrelated), the other girl from their school who went to Syria in 2014.

link_mentions.page: List of people who disappeared mysteriously: post-1990
response: |Sharmeena Begum also spelled "Shamina" was a jihadi bride who was last seen in June 2018 in Baghuz, Syria, and was declared missing in February 2019. Begum has not been seen since.

Shortly after her departure, Begum's sister expressed hope that she and her school friends had travelled to ISIL territory only to bring back their friend Sharmeena Begum (no relation), who had travelled there in 2014.
|Sharmeena Begum || 1999 || 2014 ||  Missing, last confirmed alive in Baghuz in 2019||   ||
